title: Anybody knows what this script font is?
content:
I am looking for a similar script.

Does anybody know something look a like?  
I like the fact that some part of the letters are bold  
and some are thin.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Y.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119062635/http:/typophile.com/files/Y.jpg) | 29.32 KB |

 [‹ What is the purpose of embellished type?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119062635/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40940 "Go to previous forum topic") [does anybody know what this script font is ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119062635/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40634 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ericquenneville

comments.content:
Hi Eric,

got answered by Miss Tiff [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119062635/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40634) …  
F

Just curious what the planned application will be? I don’t imagine this being a very useful/easy to read text copy. Are you creating a logo with it? If so, I’d recommend going the extra step and reproducing it by hand with real ink and brushes.

I did a basic brush script search at myfonts and came across some designs that are similar:

[http://www.myfonts.com/browse/foundry/andinistas/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119062635/http:/www.myfonts.com/browse/foundry/andinistas/ "http://www.myfonts.com/browse/foundry/andinistas/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/browse/foundry/misprinted/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119062635/http:/www.myfonts.com/browse/foundry/misprinted/ "http://www.myfonts.com/browse/foundry/misprinted/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/p22/vincent/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119062635/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/p22/vincent/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/p22/vincent/")

Most of these seem like grunge/brush scripts.
